column2: redabogado, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Works as well as prescription sleep aids. I take it with ibuprofen mix.

column2: peter mack, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using Alka-Seltzer PM for some time as the other brands don't seem to work for me.  If I take one tablet I get about 4 hours of sleep, but will fall asleep again in less than a half hour.  If I take both tablets I will wake up feeling very groggy for at least two hours.

column2: tbailey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have always had trouble sleeping and in the past have used Tylenol PM which rarely worked. I finally checked out the active ingredients at the store and decided to try Excedrin PM because of the Diphenhydramine citrate. The first night I took two and slept for 14 hours. When I did wake up I was vary drowsy for at least an hour and a half. Now I only take 1 around 7pm and I go to sleep around 10:30 easily. Works great.

column2: giselshoe, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I am taking OTC Dighenhydramine HCI 25mg with Acetamineophen 500mg (Family Dollar) store since 6 years.I take it about 2hours before bedtime and I wake up in the morning feeling perfect.

column2: Hector, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Since I have been taking the Excedrin PM I have not had any more allergys and have been sleeping much better and wake up without feeling groogy.

column2: bwb30815, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started having Hives after a skin graft.When I don't take Diphenhydramine (Benadryl)I start itching then then hives start appearing.

column2: Flaqui4, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I take Advil PM to help me fall asleep, specially if I have a pain in my body due to my period or if I have a cold, and it works extremelly well. I wake up feeling rested and not feeling groggy at all. I highly recommend it!

column2: kathryn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I suffer from Insomnia and have found that Diphenhydramine Citrate works much better for me than Diphenhydramine HCL. D-HCL makes me so groggy all the next day, but Citrate does not! I've read many posts around the internet - I'm glad I'm not alone. We are all searching for D-Citrate without pain reliever in it. Can't find :(

column2: sleepless on nights off, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I don't know how diphenhydramine HCL and diphenhydramine citrate differ, but I am very restless with the HCL version and awaken very groggy for hours. I take only 25mg =1 tablet. When I take 1 tablet= 38mg citrate variety I rest well, not groggy. I did take a second tablet once in the middle of the night after awakening feeling fully rested, and even then not groggy next day.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is the drug that is in Advil PM. I have used this a couple of times to assist in sleeping as another medication I am taking sometimes causes insomnia. I find it does help me to fall asleep although it does leave me groggy when I wake up in the mroning.
